results.title: Up, down, all around: math readiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ” Math readiness”
Uses a story about a lion and his troubles in building his house in order to illustrate the characteristics of directiional relationships.
Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

group_siblings.title: This one with that one: math readiness

results.title: This one with that one: math readiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math readiness”
Uses a story about a fisherman who cannot decide how to match his lines, baits and fish, in order to illustrate the concept of one-to-one matching.
Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

group_siblings.title: Up, down, all around: math readiness

results.title: Mammals with hoofs
results.creator_credit: William J. Hood and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the hoofed mammals called ungulates, including those which are even-toed, such as hippopotamuses, pigs and deer, and those that are odd-toed, such as rhinocereoses and horses. Describes their diets, feeding habits, special adaptations and usefulness to humans. Suitable for middle and uppere primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Surveys the hoofed mammals called ungulates, including those which are even-toed, such as hippopotamuses, pigs and deer, and those that are odd-toed, such as rhinocereoses and horses. Describes their diets, feeding habits, special adaptations and usefulness to humans. Suitable for middle and uppere primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Kim's looking glass: new baby at home
results.brief_description: Tells the story of how a girl uses a magic mirror to reverse things to the way they were before the birth of her baby sister. Shows how loneliness and jealousy are natural reactions of children to having a new baby in the family.

results.title: Who are we? Episode 1. Hands and feet
results.brief_description: Shows hands and feet in animals and humans noting differences in size, shape, number, function, adaptability and effect on performance. Suitable for lower secondary level. No dialogue.

results.title: Electromagnets and their uses
results.brief_description: Shows how electricity can be used to make magnets, and presents various applications of electromagnets. Describes the effects of coiling a wire and adding a core, and demonstrates the effect of current direction on polarity. Suitable for upper primary level.
